position.marginalia_text: Item Notetis, quod Incolume dicitur sanum, vel mundum ab omni causa corruptionis

marginalia.translation: Also note that the unharmed are said to be sane or the world free of any cause of corruption.

position.marginalia_text: Item Hermes inquit, Filij, Philosophoru[m] corpora sunt septem: quoru[m] primus est sol, eorum optimus rex & Caput, quod nec terra corrumpit, nec res combure[n]s comburrit: nec aqua alteratur, eo quod complexio eius est temperata, & Natura directa, in caliditate &c

marginalia.translation: Likewise, Hermes says, sons, there are seven bodies of the philosophers: the first of them is the sun, their greatest king and head. It does not not corrupt the world, nor does the destructive thing destroy. Nor is water altered, because its constitution is tempered and its natue directed in heat etc.
